node.title: Omicron may protect against Delta COVID-19 variant, research suggests
node.alt: A health worker stands behind a clear screen wearing PPE as she uses a long white swab to take a nasal sample from a man
node.description: Since hitting the headlines in November, the Omicron COVID-19 variant has damaged economies, destroyed holidays and blighted the festive season, but scientists say there mayÂ be a silver lining to the fast-moving version of the virus.
node.content:
["Since hitting the headlines in November, the Omicron COVID-19 variant has damaged economies, destroyed holidays and blighted the festive season, but scientists say there may\u00a0be a silver lining to the fast-moving version of the virus.", "Research conducted in a laboratory in South Africa suggests Omicron may\u00a0protect the people it infects against the more-severe Delta variant.", "If shown to be true, that could mean Omicron will have the ability to displace Delta.", "\"Such an outcome may have positive implications in terms of decreasing the COVID-19 burden of severe disease,\" the authors of the study said.", "The study \u2014\u00a0led by scientists at the Africa Health Research Institute in Durban \u2014\u00a0is yet to be peer-reviewed, but epidemiologist Catherine Bennett from Deakin University said the potential\u00a0was promising.", "Professor Bennett said she and others in her field had been wondering whether Omicron might offer protection against other variants.", "\"That was a hope,\" she said.", "
'We have to be mindful this study was small'
", "Just 15 vaccinated and unvaccinated people infected with Omicron enrolled in the study.", "In a laboratory, the research team tested how well participants' antibodies neutralised the Omicron and Delta versions while they had symptoms, and then again two weeks later.", "The results of their study showed participants developed an antibody response to Omicron that increased 14-fold over the two weeks.", "They also noticed that their ability to neutralise the Delta variant increased more than fourfold.", "What the study also showed was that antibodies from vaccinated participants were better able to fight off the Delta variant, while those from unvaccinated participants were more variable.", "\"We have to be mindful this study was small,\" Professor Bennett said.", "She also said South Africa's high rates of Delta infections raised questions about the results.", "In her opinion, it was unclear whether participants' antibodies were able to neutralise the Delta variant because they had been exposed to it in the past, or because they had been exposed more recently to Omicron.", "
Omicron infection could protect from severe Delta disease
", "After the Delta variant broke out in South Africa, the country recorded more than 20,000 new COVID-19 cases a day during the peak of its third wave of infections.", "Daily rates of new infections hit similar heights after Omicron was first detected in South Africa in November\u00a0but, after peaking just before Christmas, infection rates have steeply dropped to between 3,000 and 5,000 new cases a day.", "The world has been watching South Africa's experience with Omicron closely. Its short wave of\u00a0infections and now indications that Omicron might be able to displace Delta are being seen as positive signs.", "Early in South Africa's experience with Omicron, it became clear the variant was able to re-infect people who had already been infected with Delta.", "The authors of the new study now think that will not happen in reverse.", "Professor Bennett said the research suggested that, instead of Omicron causing concern about reinfections, it might have the positive effect of preventing a swing back to the more-severe Delta variant.", "She also pointed out another upside in that, if unvaccinated people become infected with Omicron, it could protect them from developing the severe disease caused by an infection with Delta.", "\"We don't want anyone to have an infection if they can avoid it, but it might mean they can avoid landing up in hospital,\" she said.", "", "
How to take a rapid antigen test
"]
